message.content: This question requires knowledge of the xylem, which is a part of a plant's vascular system responsible for transporting water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant. Option (B) is correct because by putting a rose in food dye, we can observe how the xylem transports the dye up the stem and into the petals, resulting in the color change of the rose. Options (A), (C), and (D) are unrelated to observing the xylem at work.

This question requires knowledge about the function of xylem in plants. Xylem is responsible for transporting water and nutrients from the roots to the rest of the plant. Option (B) is the correct answer because when a rose is placed in food dye, the xylem in the stem will transport the dye up to the petals, causing the petals to change color. Option (A) is incorrect because organizing flowers in a bouquet does not demonstrate the function of xylem. Option (C) is incorrect because pulling a plant from the root will not show the xylem in action. Option (D) is incorrect because pouring water on a plant does not specifically demonstrate the function of xylem.
